intro: Luzula multiflora var. congesta, commonly known as the clustered woodrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Juncaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Luzula multiflora var. congesta is often used in ornamental horticulture for its attractive foliage and ability to tolerate wet conditions.
